metadata.titel_preek: Easter Season Sermons: John 20 and Job 42

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Death and the vacuum of human doubt to restore life and faith through His own initiative.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The risen, living, reigning Christ says to us today...
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.

object.identificatie: Life and Faith (Restoration of the human Receiver)
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
that you may believe... and that, believing, you may have life

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Sovereign Creator
tekstueel_bewijs: Almighty God, who through thine only-begotten Son Jesus Christ overcame death

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (Mary, Thomas, Job, the Congregation)
tekstueel_bewijs: opened unto us the gate of everlasting life
blessed are they who do not see and yet believe

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Proclaimed Word
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith
the living Word of God, which is unique and trustworthy
the night in which Sin and Death reign
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is described as a 'kingdom' and 'merciless' power that human effort (spices, burial customs) cannot defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of faith and confession following the divine encounter.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Thomas/Job)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response (Secondary) is strictly a result of the Divine action (Primary). Thomas believes only because Christ appears.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He arose from the kingdom of Death.
The Lord looks straight through Thomas... to you and to me.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.
Job simply sets aside all his great sufferings.

voorbeelden: he must rise from the dead
Job’s great longing is for revelation.
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
God... revealed himself as the one who was already present

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' to act where humans are 'unable' (dust). Grace is the endowment of life to the dead.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) through ~S1 (Doubt/Dust) to S1 (Resurrection) via the intervention of the Subject.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ passes through the 'linen bands' of death, moving the Receiver from the 'dust' to 'eternal life'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are characterized by 'darkness', 'dust', and 'doubt' until acted upon.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If we don’t like the tornadoes... we can absolve our man-made gods.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The reign of Death is stark, merciless, irrevocable.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as 'Receivers' of God's action, not as moral models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Thomas is not a model of doubt to overcome, but a recipient of Christ's gracious appearance.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and comfort in the face of mortality and doubt.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic: faith is a gift created by the Word, not a human work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative consistently places God in the position of Subject across Old and New Testament examples.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit creates faith where it was absent.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'night' and 'death'—a state of being rather than just mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The 'engine' is grace-driven.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Easter.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology precedes and enables the response of faith.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, consistently making God the Subject of the resurrection narrative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'night' imagery, Greimas shows that 'night' functions as a specific Actant (Opponent) that only a Divine Subject can overcome.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'stolen body' theory; Greimas shows that Mary's role is a 'Receiver' whose 'Savoir' (knowledge) is corrected by the Subject's 'Performance'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by treating Thomas and Job as passive beneficiaries of revelation rather than heroes of persistence.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace perfectly.
